alert.note: Alert for Lexington; Richland (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued April 19 at 9:13AM EDT until April 22 at 8:00AM EDT by NWS Columbia
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Columbia has issued a Flood Advisory for the following rivers in South Carolina... Congaree River At Columbia affecting Lexington and Richland Counties. ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM THIS MORNING TO FRIDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall and upstream dam operations is expected. * WHERE...Congaree River At Columbia. * WHEN...From this morning to Friday morning. * IMPACTS...At 10.0 feet, Flooding occurs in flood prone areas near and downstream from Columbia. Flooding also occurs on parts of the Cayce and West Columbia river walk. At 13.0 feet, Flooding occurs in flood prone areas near and downstream from Columbia. Flooding also occurs over much of the Cayce and West Columbia river walk. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:00 AM EDT Tuesday the stage was 8.6 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise to 11.0 feet Wednesday morning. It will then fall below action stage by Thursday morning. - Action stage is 10.0 feet. - Flood stage is 19.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this evening by 10 PM EDT.
